titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1298) to provide assistance to foreign countries to combat HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-80, by Mr. Diaz-Balart, L..

It shall be in order to consider as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on International Relations now printed in the bill.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 28.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 210.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/1/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on April 30, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 1298 (providing assistance to foreign countries to combat HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis, and malaria).
